page.title: 08SCHOOL HISTORY
page.content: {BALLYCARRICKMADDY PRIMARY SCHOOL A National School was built here around 1830. Its remains still stand. In 1900 a new National School of 2 rooms was built.This forms part of the present school-1922 name changed to Public Elementary School.1947 changed to Primary School.1976-77 school amalgamated with two nearby closing schools. {ENROLMENT}1880=56:1930=71:1975=20: 1978=60:1985=97. {PRINCIPALS}:1830-1872 Thos. Begley 1872-1916,his son,Jacob Begley.(From 1900-1941Jacob's daughter,Eva,taught here too).1916-1928 Mr.W.Lamont: 1928-1967 Mr.S.McConnell:1967-1976 Mr.Brown:1977-Present Mr D.McCaughran. {NOTE:}-The Begley family still lives in the area. They now farm near the school and 3 fifth-generation children attend the school.
